intro: Koordersiodendron papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan koordersiodendron, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in its native habitat.
